title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 186-9.1 - Suspension or revocation of employer certificates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 186-9.1 - Suspension or revocation of employer certificates

State Regulations

The commissioner may suspend or revoke an employer
certificate of eligibility or employer certificate of group eligibility for
good cause shown, or where it is shown that the employer: (a) provided inaccurate or false information
on an application; (b) has
committed a violation of this Part that may be hazardous or detrimental to the
physical or mental health, morals, education, or general welfare of a child
performer; (c) has not transferred
the required earnings to the child performer's trust account or to the State

Comptroller; (d) has caused the
child performer to engage in or be scheduled to engage in an activity that may
be hazardous or detrimental to the physical or mental health, education, morals, or general welfare of a child performer; or
(e) being the holder of an employer
certificate of group eligibility, employed a child without the written consent
of that child's parent or guardian. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
186-9.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
